ref: 6190 darati ʻ is frightened ʼ Dhātup. [~ dalati. -- Semant. cf. dīryátē, dīrṇa -- . -- &rcirclemacr Pk. ḍaraï ʻ fears ʼ, daria -- , ḍa˚ ʻ frightened ʼ; Gy. wel. der -- ʻ to fear ʼ (pp. derino s.v. dīrṇa -- : all other eur. dialects < dārayati), K. ḍarun, S. ḍ̠araṇu, L. ḍaraṇ, P. ḍarnā; WPah.bhad. ḍaraṇ n. ʻ scarecrow ʼ, bhal. ḍarāi f. ʻ threat ʼ; Ku. ḍarṇo ʻ to fear ʼ, N. ḍarnu, A. ḍariba, B. ḍarā, Or. ḍaribā, Aw.lakh. ḍarab, H. ḍarnā, Marw. ḍarṇo, G. ḍarvũ, M. ḍarṇẽ. -- Ext. -- pp -- : H. ḍarapnā ʻ to be afraid ʼ, OMarw. ḍarapaï, G. ḍarapvũ.
